intro: Hyparrhenia hirta var. garambensis, commonly known as the Garambensi grass, is a perennial grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It typically grows in open woodlands, savannas, and along riverbanks, preferring well-drained soils. Its inflorescence consists of a cylindrical spikelet, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. This grass is often used for soil stabilization and as a forage crop for livestock.
